AT0066.title: Fake Apps
AT0066.description: Fake apps are malicious mobile applications that impersonate legitimate applications by mimicking the names, icons, and interface designs of well-known apps to deceive users into downloading and installing them, then implementing phishing, information theft, or backdoor implantation. Main characteristics include high-fidelity interfaces, permission abuse, malicious code implantation, push phishing, SMS interception on Android devices, and distribution through third-party app stores, phishing websites, and social media links.

references.title: Regulations on the Administration of Mobile Internet Application Information Services
